title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Monday 9 October 2017 - BBC News
summary: mental health trust insists overnight emergency cover 'not under threat ' .
revealed : roman tunnel that looks like it was built yesterday .
maryport robot used in windscale is 'world 's cheapest ' .
cumbrian rail groups get national praise .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 've now finished posting the news , a regular weather forecast , travel reports and the occasional other nugget from around the county , for today .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll do it again from 08:00 tomorrow .

as always , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: judge calls for action to catch online sex criminals
text: a judge at carlisle crown court has called for internet companies to do more to police social media sites such as chat rooms to protect children .

judge peter davies was speaking as he jailed david mitchell , 49 , of granville road in carlisle , for nine years and four months for preying on teenage girls by pretending to be a boy on social networks .
judge davies told the court that social media sites should be rigorously monitored to identify sex offenders before they can cause serious problems .
these courts plead for internet companies and organisations to police these social media devices .
let us protect our children . ''

documents.title: missing kendal man found dead in river
text: police have confirmed that a body found in the river kent at the southern end of kendal on saturday was that of john stephenson , who 'd been missing for about 24 hours .
the body was found south of the romney road bridge ; mr stephenson , 36 , had last been seen in nearby wattsfield road on friday evening .
police say they 've no reason to be sus about the death , and the coroner has been informed .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : cloud thickening with more rain
text: cloud will thicken again from the west this evening with outbreaks of rain and strengthening winds again for a time tonight .
the minimum temperature will be about 11c ( 52f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: barrow man jailed for 'explosions ' facebook post
text: a barrow man who posted messages on facebook last week that could have encouraged people to commit acts of terrorism has been jailed for 18 months .
barrow magistrates were told that had leroy mccarthy not made his posts private , among 300 friends , he would have been charged with a terror offence .

in messages , mostly on 6 october , mccarthy said it would not be possible to evacuate barrow 's furness general hospital before one of three explosions ; there were references to the flag of so-called islamic state , the killer of the soldier lee rigby , martydom , a knife , and postings on other days that were anti-semitic and homophobic .
mitigating , maureen fawcett said mccarthy , 22 , of hall street in barrow , was someone for whom `` not very bright is an understatement '' .
he had taken valium , had ongoing mental health problems and had pleaded guilty at the first opportunity to an offence under communications legislation .

documents.title: police : help us catch cumbria 's modern-day slavers
text: police in cumbria say they are receiving more than 100 reports every six months of people being enslaved in the county .
officers say a number of cases are being investigated and more than 30 people have been `` rescued '' .
today officers said there might be many more cases that were not being reported to them , and the charity crimestoppers began a campaign to alert the public to look out for the signs .
the threat of modern slavery is real and is happening in cumbria and we ca n't allow this type of crime to become established . ''
`` the message to you is simple - if you see something sus please report it . ''

he 's now heading into scotland , hopefully close enough to the shore to avoid the racing tides of the solway .

documents.title: driver who dozed off after lakes walk is banned
text: a walker who fell asleep and crashed her car on her way back from a day out in the lake district has been banned from driving for a year .
rosemary bryant , 55 , from port carlisle , admitted dangerous driving on the a595 near mealsgate as she drove home from derwentwater .

the court heard she 'd opened the windows of her vauxhall corsa and listened to bbc radio 4 , but dozed off and left the road after returning to classic fm , despite knowing , according to prosecutor beccy mcgregor , that classical music `` normally sent her to sleep '' .
bryant was also ordered to do 80 hours of unpaid work by a judge at carlisle crown court and will have to take an extended test before she can drive again .

documents.title: copeland people given say in future plans
text: people in copeland have a chance to say where developments such as housing , employment , and wind energy should go over the next 17 years .
the council is currently reviewing its local plan , and people have until 17 november to have their say .
you can find out more about it here .

documents.title: anti-piracy veterans begin fifth year in chennai jail
text: six men , including john armstrong from wigton , are beginning their fifth year in custody in india after being arrested while working on an anti-piracy vessel , protecting shipping from attack off the coast of somalia .
indian officials found firearms on the ship , the seaman guard ohio , which they alleged were not properly licensed , in 2013 , and last year , the six were sentenced to five years imprisonment .
since then , their families have campaigned for their release .
this thursday , they will be lobbying mps and will hand in a poetition to no 10 , downing street .
we 're just trying to keep a positive mind-frame and keep looking forward .
our aim is to have this conviction overturned . ''

documents.title: watch : whitewash wiped from banksy 's £ 1.25m graffiti
text: in a secret 18-month operation , a famous lost work by the graffiti artist banksy has been rescued from its whitewashed wall by cumbrian experts .

after the brickwork toilet wall on which it was originally painted was cut out and carefully put in a steel frame by tweddle engineering of wigton , chris bull of fine art restoration in carlisle cleaned the artwork for display back in london .
he told the story to reporter chris jackson for tonight 's inside out on bbc1 .

documents.title: telegraph pole delays longtown wind farm convoys
text: the company building the hallburn windfarm near longtown says the loads carried through the town this afternoon wo n't cause as much delay to traffic as they expected because of a telegraph pole .

the pole means the lorries wo n't be able to swing around a corner with the 49m-long turbine blade on the back , so instead the company will be transporting a nacelle , which contains the generating equipment , and part of the base , or pillar to the site .
you can see what it looks like here .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : brighter for a while
text: it may brighten up a bit this afternoon , with gentle winds and temperatures of 15c ( 59f ) .
but it will be cloudy again this evening , with more rain overnight and stronger winds .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .

documents.title: travel : roadworks delay traffic between barrow and ulverston again
text: traffic is queuing at pennington lane on the a590 between barrow and ulverston .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: barrow man faces sex attack charges
text: a man from barrow is due in court accused of attempting to rape and sexually assault a woman in the town on friday evening .
the 36-year-old from ramsden street is due before furness magistrates ' court today .

documents.title: watch and listen : star singer who first appeared in cumbria
text: singer katheleen ferrier will be honoured with a blue plaque in west cumbria today .
members of her family will unveil the plaque this afternoon at st kentigern 's church in aspatria , where the singer gave her first paid performance .

documents.title: curle calls on 'true fans ' after another defeat
text: manager keith curle says `` true supporters '' will still turn up to watch carlisle united at brunton park , despite seeing just three home wins since 2016 .
united lost a tight match 1-0 at against league two leaders exeter at the weekend , meaning they 've won only once in nine home games this season .
the true supporters , they will understand and they will come and view the game and have a good understanding of how we 're trying to play . ''
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: travel : turbines lorries will delay longtown traffic
text: the company building a wind farm near longtown says large wind turbine parts will be carried through the town today and could cause travel delays .
a spokesman for reg power management ltd said the convoy was expected to pass through the town between 15:00 and 15:30 .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: hos opens sensory room for children
text: a specially-created area to improve the lives of children with life-limiting conditions in cumbria is being officially opened at the county 's hos today .
jigsaw , which is part of eden valley hos was given £ 25,000 to pay for the project by the aviva community fund .
staff there say they see children react in a way they do nowhere else .

we 've got bubble tubes that light up , we 've got walls that vibrate , so you 'll hear lots of laughter , you might see eyes flickering , it 's a space that has just been transformed and it 's wonderful to see . ''

documents.title: n-plant fire crews reject pay offer and plan strike
text: firefighters at the sellafield nuclear site are to stage two days of strike action later this month in a dispute over pay .
members of the gmb union will walk out between between 06:00 and 18:30 on 17 october and 19 october .
earlier strike plans were suspended while they considered a new pay offer , but the union , which claims its members have been underpaid for years , says it was n't enough .

a spokeswoman for sellafield ltd said the company remained open to further discussion : `` our focus is on putting in place arrangements to ensure the site remains safe during any industrial action . ''

documents.title: new recruit joins mountain weather team
text: new recruit joins mountain weather team

documents.title: travel : crash blocks sedbergh road in kendal
text: sedbergh road , the a684 in kendal , is closed after an accident between rusland park and castle road .
police are operating diversions .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbrian firm frames banksy 's whitewashed copper
text: work by the graffiti artist banksy has been restored with help from a cumbrian engineering firm and a carlisle restoration expert
the `` snorting copper '' image , showing a police officer bending down to sniff cocaine , was sprayed on to the wall of a public toilet in hackney about 12 years ago , and then whitewashed over .
now worth an estimated £ 1.25m , the brickwork was carefully removed when the toilets were demolished to make way for an office .
the painted block was taken to tweddle engineering in wigton , who attached it to a frame and gave it to an art restorer in carlisle , chris bull , who brought it back it to its subversive glory .
author: Chris Jackson
BBC Inside Out

documents.title: sellafield fire crews ' strikes go ahead
text: sellafield fire crews ' strikes go ahead

documents.title: work starts on 60-bed whitehaven care home
text: the first sod is being cut today for a new 60-bed care home in whitehaven .
cumbria county council says the £ 6m residential home on cleator moor road will be able to cater for people with dementia and complex care needs .
the home opens in 2019 and replaces older homes in brackenthwaite , dentholme , castle mount and pow beck .

documents.title: barrow man in court after arrest by counter-terror police
text: a 22-year-old man 's due to appear in court in barrow this morning after a raid by counter-terrorism officers at the weekend .
leroy mccarthy , of hall street , was arrested after police from the north west counter terrorism unit and the cumbria force went to a property there on saturday night .
he 's been charged with improper use of a public telecommunications network .

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : a grey start , brighter later
text: it 'll be a mild but fairly cloudy start to the day and there will be some spots of light rain and drizzle at times , especially over the hills .
it will tend to brighten this afternoon with gentle westerly winds and a maximum temperature of 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .

documents.title: good morning , and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be keeping up with the news and travel reports , posting a regular weather forecast , and dropping in the odd other nugget from the county , through until about 18:00 .

as always , if you want to pass on news you think we should know , or share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
